did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Betty Berzon papers, 1972-1979.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Tape recordings of a UCLA Extension Program, "The Homosexual in America," June 21, 1972; printed materials; and memorabilia, including buttons, reflecting the women's liberation movements in the 1970s, chiefly in Los Angeles and Southern California. Includes documentation of the Briggs Initiative to prohibit lesbian and gay teachers from being employed by public schools.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Author and gay/lesbian leader in Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Tape recordings of a UCLA Extension Program, "The Homosexual in America," June 21, 1972; printed materials; and memorabilia, including buttons, reflecting the women's liberation movements in the 1970s, chiefly in Los Angeles and Southern California. Includes documentation of the Briggs Initiative to prohibit lesbian and gay teachers from being employed by public schools.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Betty Berzon papers, #7312. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
